anomaly_signal: Providers billing >16 hours/day of personal care services per attendant, where P95 for legitimate providers is 10 hours/day
baseline: Historical distribution of daily service hours per attendant, by state and service type
false_positive_risk: Live-in caregivers in self-directed programs may legitimately bill extended hours

anomaly_signal: Newly enrolled HCBS agencies (within 90 days) generating >$200K in first-quarter claims, where median for new agencies is $15K
baseline: Distribution of first-quarter billing for new HCBS providers, by state
false_positive_risk: Acquisitions of existing agencies may appear as new enrollments with immediate high volume

anomaly_signal: HCBS personal care claims for beneficiaries simultaneously enrolled in residential facilities (ALF, group homes) where personal care would be duplicative
baseline: Cross-reference HCBS claims with facility enrollment records
false_positive_risk: Some HCBS services are legitimately provided in residential settings (e.g., community integration)

anomaly_signal: PACE organizations with participant hospitalization rates >50% below comparable FFS dual-eligible population, suggesting systematic access barriers or undertriage
baseline: Expected hospitalization rates for nursing-facility-eligible dual populations by geographic area
false_positive_risk: Well-managed PACE programs legitimately reduce hospitalizations through preventive care

anomaly_signal: AHCAH programs billing acute DRG rates with average length-of-stay <2 days or readmission rates >30% (suggesting patients discharged from home care prematurely or never truly acute)
baseline: Inpatient DRG-specific average LOS and readmission rates for comparable diagnoses
false_positive_risk: Some conditions treated at home may genuinely resolve faster than inpatient equivalents

anomaly_signal: 340B covered entities with contract pharmacy volume >500% of in-house pharmacy volume, or contract pharmacies >50 miles from any covered entity site
baseline: Distribution of contract-to-in-house pharmacy ratios across covered entity types
false_positive_risk: Rural covered entities may legitimately rely heavily on distant contract pharmacies
